from pyspark.sql import functions as F
from notebookutils import mssparkutils

BASE = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net"
EXTRACT = f"{BASE}/MPESC-EXTRACT"
OUT = f"{BASE}/TRANSFORM-CASE"

CASE_REF_FILE = f"{EXTRACT}/Horizon_CaseReference.csv"
LLATTR_CASE_GLOB = f"{EXTRACT}/LLAttr/Case_*/part*.csv"

case_ref = spark.read.option("header", True).option("inferSchema", True).csv(CASE_REF_FILE)

display(case_ref.limit(10))
print("case_ref rows:", case_ref.count())

PREFIXES = ["COM/", "ENV/", "MCA/", "PUR/", "ROW/"]

prefix_filter = None
for p in PREFIXES:
    cond = F.col("CaseReference").startswith(p)
    prefix_filter = cond if prefix_filter is None else (prefix_filter | cond)

filtered_cases = (
    case_ref
    .filter(prefix_filter)
    .select(
        F.col("CaseUniqueId").alias("caseReference"),
        F.col("CaseReference").alias("hznReference"),
        F.col("CaseTypeId").alias("caseTypeId"),
        F.col("CaseNodeId").alias("caseNodeId"),
        F.col("CaseCreateDate").alias("caseCreateDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseDate").alias("caseCloseDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseStatus").alias("caseCloseStatus"),
        F.col("CaseOwnerId").alias("caseOwnerId")
    )
)

display(filtered_cases.limit(10))
print("filtered cases:", filtered_cases.count())

        F.col("CaseCloseStatus").alias("caseCloseStatus"),

    )
)

display(filtered_cases.limit(10))
print("filtered cases:", filtered_cases.count())

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

BASE = "abfss://horizon-migration-poc@pinsstodwdevuks9h80mb.dfs.core.windows.net"
EXTRACT = f"{BASE}/MPESC-EXTRACT"
OUT = f"{BASE}/TRANSFORM-CASE"

CASE_REF_FILE = f"{EXTRACT}/Horizon_CaseReference.csv"

# your prefixes
PREFIXES = ["COM/", "ENV/", "MCA/", "PUR/", "ROW/"]

case_ref = spark.read.option("header", True).option("inferSchema", True).csv(CASE_REF_FILE)

prefix_filter = None
for p in PREFIXES:
    cond = F.col("CaseReference").startswith(p)
    prefix_filter = cond if prefix_filter is None else (prefix_filter | cond)

filtered_cases = (
    case_ref
    .filter(prefix_filter)
    .select(
        F.col("CaseUniqueId").alias("caseReference"),
        F.col("CaseReference").alias("hznReference"),
        F.col("CaseTypeId").alias("caseTypeId"),
        F.col("CaseNodeId").alias("caseNodeId"),
        F.col("CaseCreateDate").alias("caseCreateDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseDate").alias("caseCloseDate"),
        F.col("CaseCloseStatus").alias("caseCloseStatus"),
        F.col("CaseOwnerId").alias("caseOwnerId")
    )
    .dropDuplicates(["caseReference"])
)

display(filtered_cases.limit(10))
print("filtered cases:", filtered_cases.count())

LLATTR_CASE_GLOB = f"{EXTRACT}/LLAttr/Case_*/part*.csv"

ll_case = spark.read.option("header", True).option("inferSchema", True).csv(LLATTR_CASE_GLOB)

# Ensure join keys are same type
cases_keys = filtered_cases.select(F.col("caseNodeId").cast("string").alias("caseNodeIdKey")).dropDuplicates()

attrs_filtered = (
    ll_case
    .withColumn("ID", F.col("ID").cast("string"))
    .join(cases_keys, F.col("ID") == F.col("caseNodeIdKey"), "inner")
    .drop("caseNodeIdKey")
)

print("attrs_filtered:", attrs_filtered.count())
display(attrs_filtered.limit(5))

# Common system-ish columns we usually don't want in the final wide dataset
drop_cols = [c for c in ["AttrID", "AttrType", "DataType",  "RowNum", "Partition", "FileName"] if c in attrs_filtered.columns]

attrs_clean = attrs_filtered.drop(*drop_cols)

print("Dropped cols:", drop_cols)
print("Remaining attr cols:", len(attrs_clean.columns))

# If attrs has multiple rows per ID, collapse to 1 row per ID
# (prevents case duplication)
attrs_one_row = attrs_clean.dropDuplicates(["ID"])

cases_joined = (
    filtered_cases.alias("c")
    .join(
        attrs_one_row.alias("a"),
        F.col("c.caseNodeId").cast("string") == F.col("a.ID").cast("string"),
        "left"
    )
    .drop("ID")  # since we already have caseNodeId
)

display(cases_joined.limit(10))
print("cases_joined rows:", cases_joined.count())

TYPE_OF_CASE_FILE = f"{EXTRACT}/Horizon_TypeOfCase.csv"
type_of_case = spark.read.option("header", True).option("inferSchema", True).csv(TYPE_OF_CASE_FILE)

final_df = (
    cases_joined.alias("x")
    .join(type_of_case.alias("t"), F.col("x.caseTypeId") == F.col("t.ID"), "left")
    .drop(F.col("t.ID"))
)

display(final_df.limit(10))

attr_rename_map = {

    "77": "lpaName",
    "70": "nationalPlanningCaseworkReference",
    "94": "nfa",
    "93": "omaStance",
    "69": "otherRelatedAppeals",
    "72": "portalUrl",
    "5": "procedure",
    "4": "procedureAppellant",
    "3": "procedureLpa",
    "55": "processingStateAttr",
    "68": "redeterminedIndicator",
    "87": "regulation",
    "88": "regulator",
    "96": "sch6Notice",
    "90": "section",
    "97": "slaDateMet",
    "71": "sourceIndicator",

print(sorted(final_df_named.columns))
display(final_df_named.limit(10))
df = final_df_named.cache()
df.count()
df.columns
df.select("caseTypeAttr").distinct().show(truncate=False)
df.select("caseTypeId").distinct().show(truncate=False)

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

case_type_map = {
    "2":  "call-ins",
    "17": "coastal-access",
    "18": "common-land",
    "19": "environment",
    "20": "high-hedges",
    "21": "other-sos-casework",
    "22": "purchase-notices",
    "23": "rights-of-way"
}

keys_list = list(case_type_map.keys())
map_expr = F.create_map([F.lit(x) for kv in case_type_map.items() for x in kv])

df_mapped = df.withColumn(
    "caseTypeName",
    F.when(
        F.col("caseTypeId").cast("string").isin(keys_list),
        map_expr.getItem(F.col("caseTypeId").cast("string"))
    ).otherwise(F.lit(None))
)

df_mapped.select("caseTypeId", "caseTypeName") \
    .distinct() \
    .orderBy(F.col("caseTypeId").cast("int")) \
    .show(truncate=False)

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

df.groupBy("applicationSubtype").count().show(100, truncate=False)

from pyspark.sql import functions as F

application_subtype_map = {
    # Rights of Way
    "DMMO under WCA: 7": "opposed-dmmo",
    "DMMO under WCA: 8": "opposed-dmmo",
    "Appeal under WCA: 14A": "schedule-14-appeal",
    "Direction under WCA: 14D": "schedule-14-direction",
    "Diversion under HA: 4": "opposed-ppo-ha80",
    "Creation under HA: 6": "opposed-ppo-ha80",
    "Extinguishment under HA: 3": "opposed-ppo-ha80",
    "Stopping up or diversion of highways": "opposed-ppo-ha80",
    "Stopping up or diversion under TCPA: 5": "opposed-ppo-tcpa90",

    # Trees / High Hedges
    "High Hedges": "high-hedges",
    "Tree Preservation Orders": "tree-lopping",
    "Tree Preservation Orders (Fast track)": "tree-lopping",
    "Tree Replacement Notices": "tree-lopping",
    "Tree Replacement Notices (Fast track)": "tree-lopping",

    # Common Land
    "Compulsory Purchase Order": "compulsory-purchase-cl",

    # Environment / Coastal
    "Environmental Permitting": "environment",
    "Environmental Liability": "environment",
    "Notice Appeals": "notice-appeal",

    # Other SOS
    "Discontinuance Order": "discontinuance-notice",
    "Traffic Regulation Orders": "other-sos-casework",
    "Use of land for civil aviation purposes": "other-sos-casework"
}

map_expr = F.create_map(
    [F.lit(x) for kv in application_subtype_map.items() for x in kv]
)

df_with_mapped = df.withColumn(
    "applicationSubtypeMapped",
    map_expr.getItem(F.col("applicationSubtype"))
)

df_with_mapped.select(
    "applicationSubtype",
    "applicationSubtypeMapped"
).distinct().orderBy("applicationSubtype").show(truncate=False)
